title: Wildcats charge past Bombers, 62-6
text:
Wildcats charge past Bombers, 62-6 NEAL DENTON, ndenton@baxterbulletin.com 10:14 p.m. CDT October 2, 2015 Buy Photo Mountain Home’s Payton Parker (9) gives a stiff-arm to a North Little Rock defender during the Bombers’ 62-6 loss on Friday night at Bomber Stadium. (Photo: Neal Denton/The Baxter Bulletin) Buy Photo 5 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
North Little Rock running backs Alex Day and Darius Austin each rushed for more than 100 yards, and the Charging Wildcats charged past the Mountain Home Bombers, 62-6, in a 7A/6A-East Conference game Friday night at Bomber Stadium. 
Day rushed for 163 yards on 11 carries, while Austin ran for 119 yards on nine totes. The junior duo combined for just three of the Wildcats’ nine touchdowns, however, as several North Little Rock players were in on the scoring. 
North Little Rock picked up its first victory of the season, moving to 1-4 overall and 1-1 in conference play. The Bombers fell to 1-4 and 0-2 and have lost 24 consecutive league games. Mountain Home returns to action Friday when it travels to Little Rock to face the Central High Tigers. 
Through the first quarter, it appeared the teams were going to be locked in a close battle. Quarterback Corvasea Cooney kept for a touchdown to get the Wildcats on the board, but the Bombers answered with a 15-play, 56-yard drive to pull within 7-6 with 4:00 left in the opening period. 
Cord Smith carried six times on the drive, including a 1-yard carry toward the right sideline for a touchdown. Mountain Home forced a North Little Rock punt, but was forced to punt itself. 
On the first play from scrimmage, Austin sprinted 50 yards for the Wildcats’ second score with 12 seconds left in the quarter, and it was all North Little Rock after that. 
The Wildcats racked up 527 yards off total offense, including 341 in the first half. Mountain Home netted 165 yards of offense — 84 through the air and 81 on the ground. Buy Photo 
Mountain Home quarterback Zane Walker throws a pass over North Little Rock defensive tackle Zavion Moore during the Bombers’ 62-6 loss on Friday night. (Photo: Neal Denton/The Baxter Bulletin) 
Kyleal Lewis caught a 32-yard touchdown pass from the Wildcats’ other quarterback, Trey Cox, for a 21-6 lead, and the senior receiver caught another TD pass with 6:53 left in the half for a 27-6 advantage. 
North Little Rock’s Wynton Ruth intercepted a pass from Mountain Home quarterback Zane Walker at the Wildcats’ 15-yard line, and the visitors drove 85 yards for another touchdown. Day finished things with a 13-yard touchdown run to make it 34-6 with 2:10 left. 
North Little Rock struck with another touchdown pass with 57 seconds remaining to take a 41-6 lead at the halftime break. The Bombers have allowed 68 second-quarter points over their past two games. 
Day scored his second touchdown on a 52-yard scamper, and the clock ran continuously in the second half due to the sportsmanship rule. Ruth scored on a 4-yard run with 2:45 left in the third for a 55-6 lead, and Marcus Christopher added the final touchdown with 3:28 left in the fourth. 
Cox passed for 83 yards on four completions for the Wildcats, and Cooney added one completion for 30 yards and four rushes for 57 yards. 
Walker was 15 of 23 passing for 84 yards for the Bombers. The senior quarterback also netted 47 yards on 19 carries. 
Mountain Home’s Drew Strope caught six passes for 33 yards, fullback Kolt Kincade caught five passes for 26 yards, Marcus May caught two passes for 15 yards and Payton Parker grabbed two passes for 10 yards. 
Smith rushed for 34 yards on 13 carries for the Bombers, who managed just 67 yards of offense in the second half.
